metadata.title: CVE-2022-4904 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the c-ares package. The ares_set_sortlist is missingchecks about the validity of the input string, which allows a possiblearbitrary length stack overflow. This issue may cause a denial of serviceor a limited impact on confidentiality and integrity.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4904` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libc-ares2 - 1.18.1-1ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: c-ares package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.18.1-1ubuntu0.22.04.1').
